stream_context.summary: Kaze live-prototyped the Raphael the Raven boss for Course 13, importing music, sculpting a tower and nest, and debating mechanics such as moon gravity, star projectiles and camera controls.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 is now in production; overall game sits at ~120 stars complete, overworld underway and roughly 30 % of enemies implemented.
development_findings.quote: We are currently like 120 stars done and we're working on the overworld and the enemies.

development_findings.summary: The new Raphael the Raven fight will start on a tower, flip gravity so Mario falls upward through stars, then continue on a low-gravity moon where frozen-cheese ‘ninja-stars’ appear; after three hits a Yoshi egg in a nest breaks to reveal the star.
development_findings.quote: Phase one: huge intro cutscene … his stomp sends Mario flying; you have to dodge stars until you land on the moon … pick up the ninja star and throw it at him … the egg explodes and you get a star.

development_findings.summary: Kaze intends to reuse actor-level rotation rather than global gravity to simplify code and will ask Arthur for existing planetary-gravity routines.
development_findings.quote: Programming the moon is going to be awful. I'm going to ask Arthur for his planetary gravity code.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 has a geomode bug that leaves fog enabled after material blending; requires manual work-arounds.
development_findings.quote: There's a Fast64 bug that makes Geomode's fog always on even though it shouldn't be.

development_findings.summary: Game now contains 98 songs—more than Mario Odyssey. About 80-90 % use M64 (Sac64) while 20 % are streamed due to size limits.
development_findings.quote: Right now we have, I think, 98 songs in the game … about 80-90 % of the OST is done via a MIDI-like format called M64 … the other 20 % is streamed music.

development_findings.summary: Total collectables are planned at ~180 stars plus 75 Yoshi coins, making content on par with or larger than Odyssey.
development_findings.quote: There would be 75 of those [Yoshi coins] … then stars … I think, 180 stars on top of that.

development_findings.summary: Analog camera won’t be added because the N64 controller only has one stick; D-pad already allows slow camera movement.
development_findings.quote: How am I supposed to add analog camera to this considering we only have one analog stick?

development_findings.summary: Imported the Ice Castle track, manually calculated loop points and split stereo channels for N64 streaming.
development_findings.quote: Let me find the loop points … split it into left and right channel, and then I imported both individually.

development_findings.summary: Kaze models assets directly in Blender and exports to C files via Fast64, bypassing intermediary formats.
development_findings.quote: I export them directly to a C file and the C file has all the data.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy centres on player freedom; he dislikes forced direction or artificial difficulty.
context_findings.quote: Mario 64 is about freedom and exploration. Being directed that heavily would ruin a lot of it.

context_findings.summary: He refuses to ship early access builds, comparing that to EA practices.
context_findings.quote: I can't release it before it's finished … then I would release an unfinished product. The thing that everybody hates EA for.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: Kaze and Zeina have a newborn (~2 weeks); Zeina handles more baby duties alongside animation work.
context_findings.quote: Of course, Zeina has a lot more work with it than I do … I guess I can't feed the baby, I do not have boobs.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values workout (‘big four’ lifts) but is rehabbing a knee injury.
context_findings.quote: I had a pretty terrible knee injury recently, so my squats … I'm being careful about.

context_findings.summary: He plans eventually to move from Windows 10 to Linux for development.
context_findings.quote: I'm probably going to switch to Linux eventually.

biobak.summary: Provided reference video that inspired current Raven boss direction.
biobak.quote: Let me just see if I can find the video that Biobak had sent me … that's so cool.

badub.summary: Composed multiple tracks (Ice Dungeon, Bowser’s office, elevator); praised for creativity.
badub.quote: Badub's music is great. The creativity he brings to the table is very, very sick.

zeina.summary: Handling character animations while caring for the couple’s newborn.
zeina.quote: Of course, Zeina has a lot more work with it than I do.

key_stories.title: Turning a 2-D Raven into a 3-D Moon Boss
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstormed how to adapt Raphael the Raven from Yoshi’s Island into a memorable 3-D set-piece. He settled on a tower intro, gravity flip, low-gravity moon arena, star projectiles made of frozen cheese, and a Yoshi-egg reward.
key_stories.challenge: Create a fresh, visually striking boss that respects the original while leveraging 3-D gameplay.
key_stories.process: Sketched multiple ideas live, weighed ice vs cheese themes, considered performance limits, and outlined phased attacks.
key_stories.outcome: Final concept documented; next tasks are modelling the moon, coding gravity, and animating the intro cut-scene.
key_stories.key_quote: This feels like a cool set-piece—he blocks the moon, you fall into space, land on a cheese moon, then throw frozen cheese stars at him.

key_stories.title: Looping the Ice Castle Track
key_stories.summary: Kaze imported Badub’s Ice Castle music, calculated start/end sample numbers, split stereo channels and configured loop points for N64 playback.
key_stories.challenge: N64 streamed audio requires exact hexadecimal loop values and mono/stereo splitting.
key_stories.process: Auditioned the track, identified repeat location by ear, multiplied timestamps by 32 to get sample offsets, edited the sound bank.
key_stories.outcome: Track now loops seamlessly in-game, raising total songs to 98.
key_stories.key_quote: Now we have from 0866 to 93633 and that's the loop. Okay, there should be one loop. I think we did it.

key_stories.title: Fighting the Fast64 Fog Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Lilaa diagnosed a Fast64 issue where fog remains enabled in a shared display-list despite being unchecked, breaking Course 12 visuals.
key_stories.challenge: Fog flag remained stuck ‘on’ after material blending, causing incorrect graphics on real hardware.
key_stories.process: Cross-checked Blender settings, confirmed it is a Fast64 bug tied to material bleeding, discussed work-arounds.
key_stories.outcome: Bug acknowledged; Kaze plans to adjust materials manually until Fast64 is patched.
key_stories.key_quote: There's one huge display list … first the material with fog and then the material without fog, and it doesn't turn the fog off.
